level.heading: PARTIAL APPLICABILITY OF UST REGULATIONS TO PARTICULAR UST SYSTEMS (§ 20-5502)

level.text: The following UST systems are required to comply only with the provisions of this section and with the provisions of Chapter 62:
Wastewater treatment tank systems not regulated under § 307(b) or § 402 of the Clean Water Act, 33 USC § 1151 et seq.;
Any UST system containing any radioactive material that is regulated under the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, 42 USC § 2011 et seq.;
Any UST system that is part of any emergency generator system at nuclear power generation facilities regulated by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission under 10 CFR Part 50, Appendix A;
Any airport or heliport hydrant fuel distribution system; and
No person may install an UST system identified in § 5502.1 for the purpose of storing any regulated substance unless that UST system:
Will prevent releases due to corrosion or structural failure for the operational life of the UST system;

Is cathodically protected against corrosion, constructed of noncorrodible material, steel clad with a noncorrodible material, or designed to prevent the release or threatened release of any stored regulated substance; and
Is constructed or lined with material that is compatible with the stored regulated substance.
In the event of a suspected or confirmed release from a UST system listed in § 5502.1, the owner or operator shall comply with all of the provisions of Chapter 56 except §§ 5600.7(d), 5601 and 5604.
